author: inspector.butters
content:
I have a question regarding the light client gossipsub rules. in this part of the spec, it says:

> For full nodes, the following validations MUST additionally pass before forwarding the finality_update on the network.
> 
> [IGNORE] The received finality_update matches the locally computed one exactly (as defined in create_light_client_finality_update)

this is the same for optimistic_update. 

my question is that, in the case that the full node has processed the update before receiving it from gossip, then it must have broadcasted it already, and the received update will not be forwarded because it's not newer.
AND in the case that for some reason the full node has not been able to process the local update, then it has nothing to compare to when receiving it from gossip. 

so what does this rule mean? cc. <@881905303011086387>

author: bridge-bot
content:
<etan_status> the data is sent 4s into the slot so the local data is expected to be available.

only validators in the sync committee initially send data. this rule is for every full node and ensures that only expected data is propagated further

author: inspector.butters
content:
ah interesting. I missed the "only validators in the sync committee initially send data" part. 
and if we don't have the locally computed update (due to unexpected behavior), we just ignore the received message?
